book review the winds of change writing the history of the pacific before the europeans

ANDS-Grants.description: Around 50,000 years ago, people crossed the Wallace Line and set foot on Sahul (Pleistocene Australia-New Guinea) for the first time. Rapid dispersal across the Sahul continent followed during a period of climatic deterioration. Subsequent human impacts on the landscape are well preserved in the fossil record, particularly plants. This project will implement an archaeological and palaeobotanical approach to investigate the temporal and spatial patterning of landscape use through a period of climatic change in the Late Quaternary. The results will provide a fuller understanding of the subsistence strategies and dynamics of human responses to climate change over long time periods.
ANDS-Grants.title: Discovery Projects - Grant ID: DP150102753
